intro: Omphalocarpum ghesquierei, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its small, spiny fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind. Omphalocarpum ghesquierei is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and low water availability.
